title.raw: 卷五 景帝紀 Volume 5: Annals of Emperor Jing

sentences.zh: 孝景皇帝，文帝太子也。

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaojing was the crown prince of Emperor Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaojing was Emperor Wen's crown prince.

sentences.zh: 母曰竇皇后。

translations.literal: His mother was Empress Dou.
translations.idiomatic: His mother was Empress Dou.

sentences.zh: 後七年六月，文帝崩。

translations.literal: In the seventh year thereafter, sixth month, Emperor Wen passed away.
translations.idiomatic: Seven years later, in the sixth month, Emperor Wen passed away.

sentences.zh: 丁未，太子即皇帝位，尊皇太后薄氏曰太皇太后，皇后曰皇太后。

translations.literal: On the Dingwei day, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne, honoring Empress Dowager Bo as Grand Empress Dowager, and the Empress as Empress Dowager.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Dingwei, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne, honoring Empress Dowager Bo as Grand Empress Dowager and the Empress as Empress Dowager.

translations.literal: Emperor Jing was Emperor Wen's crown prince. His mother was Empress Dou. In the seventh year, sixth month, Emperor Wen passed away. On the ding-wei day, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne. He honored Empress Dowager Bo as Grand Empress Dowager and the Empress as Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 九月，有星孛于西方。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, there was a sweeping star in the western sky.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, a comet appeared in the western sky.

translations.literal: In the ninth month, a comet appeared in the west.

sentences.zh: 元年冬十月，詔曰：「蓋聞古者祖有功而宗有德，制禮樂各有由。

translations.literal: In the first year, winter, tenth month, he issued an edict saying: 'I have heard that in ancient times ancestors had merit and descendants had virtue, and the establishment of rites and music each had their origins.'
translations.idiomatic: In the first year, during the tenth month of winter, he issued an edict: 'I have heard that in ancient times, ancestors achieved merit while descendants cultivated virtue, and the establishment of rites and music each had their proper origins.'

sentences.zh: 歌者，所以發德也；

translations.literal: Singing is what expresses virtue;
translations.idiomatic: Singing serves to express virtue;

sentences.zh: 舞者，所以明功 也。

translations.literal: dancing is what illuminates merit.
translations.idiomatic: dancing serves to illuminate merit.

sentences.zh: 高廟酎，奏武德、文始、五行之舞。

translations.literal: At the High Temple autumn sacrifices, perform the dances of Martial Virtue, Literary Beginning, and the Five Elements.
translations.idiomatic: At the autumn sacrifices in the High Temple, perform the dances of Martial Virtue, Literary Beginning, and the Five Elements.

sentences.zh: 孝惠廟酎，奏文始、五行之舞。

translations.literal: At the Temple of Emperor Hui's autumn sacrifices, perform the dances of Literary Beginning and the Five Elements.
translations.idiomatic: At the autumn sacrifices in Emperor Hui's Temple, perform the dances of Literary Beginning and the Five Elements.

sentences.zh: 孝文皇帝臨天下，通關梁，不異遠方；

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaowen, ruling the world, opened the passes and bridges, treating distant regions no differently;
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaowen, in governing the realm, opened the passes and bridges, making no distinction between distant and nearby regions;

sentences.zh: 除誹謗，去肉刑，賞賜長老，收恤孤獨，以遂群生；

translations.literal: abolished slander laws, eliminated mutilating punishments, rewarded the elderly, and provided relief to orphans and widows, so as to fulfill the lives of all people;
translations.idiomatic: he abolished slander laws, eliminated mutilating punishments, rewarded the elderly, and provided relief to orphans and widows, thereby sustaining all living beings;

sentences.zh: 減耆欲，不受獻，罪人不帑，不誅亡罪，不私其利也；

translations.literal: reduced his desires, did not accept tribute, did not implicate the families of criminals, did not execute those without guilt, and did not monopolize benefits for himself;
translations.idiomatic: he reduced his desires, declined tribute offerings, spared the families of criminals, did not execute the innocent, and did not monopolize benefits for personal gain;

sentences.zh: 除宮刑，出美人，重絕人之世也。

translations.literal: abolished palace punishments, released the palace ladies, valuing the continuation of people's lineages.
translations.idiomatic: he abolished palace punishments, released the palace ladies, and valued the preservation of family lines.

sentences.zh: 朕既不敏，弗能勝識。

translations.literal: I, being unenlightened, am unable to fully comprehend this.
translations.idiomatic: Being unenlightened as I am, I cannot fully comprehend this.

sentences.zh: 此皆上世之所不及，而孝文皇帝親行之。

translations.literal: These are all things that previous generations did not achieve, yet Emperor Xiaowen personally implemented them.
translations.idiomatic: These are all achievements that previous eras did not attain, yet Emperor Xiaowen personally accomplished them.

sentences.zh: 德厚侔天 地，利澤施四海，靡不獲福。

translations.literal: His virtue was as thick as Heaven and Earth, his beneficial influence extended to the four seas, and none did not receive fortune.
translations.idiomatic: His virtue equaled the thickness of Heaven and Earth, his beneficial influence reached to the four seas, and all received good fortune.

sentences.zh: 明象乎日月，而廟樂不稱，朕甚懼焉。

translations.literal: His brightness was like the sun and moon, yet the temple music does not match it—I am greatly fearful of this.
translations.idiomatic: His brilliance shone like the sun and moon, yet the temple music does not befit it—I am greatly apprehensive about this.

sentences.zh: 其為孝文皇帝廟為昭德之舞，以明休德。

translations.literal: Therefore, for Emperor Xiaowen's temple create the dance of Illustrious Virtue, to illuminate his blessed virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, create the Dance of Illustrious Virtue for Emperor Xiaowen's temple, to illuminate his blessed virtue.

sentences.zh: 然后祖宗之功德，施于萬世，永永無窮，朕甚嘉之。

translations.literal: Then the merit and virtue of the ancestors will extend to ten thousand generations, forever without end—I greatly commend this.
translations.idiomatic: Then the merit and virtue of our ancestors will extend to ten thousand generations, forever without end—I greatly approve of this.

sentences.zh: 其 與丞相、列侯、中二千石、禮官具禮儀奏。」

translations.literal: Therefore, together with the chancellor, marquises, officials of two thousand shi rank, and ritual officials, prepare the rites and submit them.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, together with the chancellor, marquises, officials of two thousand shi rank, and ritual officials, prepare the ceremonies and submit them.'

sentences.zh: 丞相臣嘉等奏曰：「陛下永思孝道，立昭德之舞以明孝文皇帝之盛德，皆臣嘉等愚所不及。

translations.literal: Chancellor Chen Jia and others submitted: 'Your Majesty perpetually contemplates the way of filial piety, establishing the dance of Illustrious Virtue to illuminate Emperor Xiaowen's abundant virtue—all of this surpasses what we foolish ministers can comprehend.'
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Chen Jia and others submitted: 'Your Majesty perpetually reflects on the path of filial piety, establishing the Dance of Illustrious Virtue to illuminate Emperor Xiaowen's abundant virtue—all of this exceeds what we foolish ministers can fathom.'

sentences.zh: 臣謹議：世功莫大於高皇 帝，德莫盛於孝文皇帝。

translations.literal: We respectfully propose: No merit in history surpasses Emperor Gao's, no virtue is more abundant than Emperor Xiaowen's.
translations.idiomatic: We respectfully propose: No achievement in history surpasses Emperor Gao's, no virtue is more abundant than Emperor Xiaowen's.

sentences.zh: 高皇帝廟宜為帝者太祖之廟，孝文皇帝廟宜為帝諸太宗之廟。

translations.literal: Emperor Gao's temple should be the Grand Ancestral Temple for all emperors, Emperor Xiaowen's temple should be the Grand Progenitor Temple for all emperors.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gao's temple should serve as the Grand Ancestral Temple for all emperors, Emperor Xiaowen's temple should serve as the Grand Progenitor Temple for all emperors.

sentences.zh: 天子宜世世獻祖宗之廟。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven should generation after generation offer sacrifices at the ancestral temples.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven should offer sacrifices at the ancestral temples for generation after generation.

sentences.zh: 郡國諸侯宜各為孝文皇帝立太宗之廟。

translations.literal: The feudal lords of the commanderies and kingdoms should each establish a Grand Progenitor Temple for Emperor Xiaowen.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords of the commanderies and kingdoms should each establish a Grand Progenitor Temple for Emperor Xiaowen.

sentences.zh: 諸侯王列侯使 者侍祠天子所獻祖宗之廟。

translations.literal: The envoys of the feudal kings and marquises should attend and offer sacrifices at the ancestral temples where the Son of Heaven offers sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: The envoys of the feudal kings and marquises should attend and perform sacrifices at the ancestral temples where the Son of Heaven offers his sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 請宣布天下。」

translations.literal: We request that this be proclaimed throughout the world.'
translations.idiomatic: We request that this be proclaimed throughout the empire.'

sentences.zh: 制曰「可」。

translations.literal: The imperial decree said 'Approved.'
translations.idiomatic: The imperial decree stated 'Approved.'

translations.literal: In the first year, winter, tenth month, an edict declared: 'I have heard that in ancient times, ancestors were honored for their merit and ancestral temples established for their virtue. The establishment of ritual and music each had their origins.' Singers express virtue; dancers clarify merit.' At the Gao Temple autumn sacrifice, perform the Martial Virtue, Literary Beginning, and Five Phases dances. At the Xiaohui Temple autumn sacrifice, perform the Literary Beginning and Five Phases dances. In spring, first month, an edict declared: 'Agriculture is the foundation of the realm. No duty is greater.' Order the commanderies and kingdoms to diligently encourage farming and sericulture, increase planting of trees, so that clothing and food may be obtained.' Order the regional kings, marquises, and officials of 2000 shi to share in labor with the people.' In summer, fourth month, yi-mao day, he granted amnesty to the realm. On ding-you day, he granted amnesty to the realm. In the fifth month, an edict declared: 'Commend filial piety, fraternal duty, and working the fields. Call them "Three Elders," "Filial and Fraternal," "Working the Fields." Each receives five bolts of silk.' Order the imperial secretaries: 'Inspect and recommend from the Three Adjuncts, Three Rivers, and Hongnong two each of "Three Elders," "Filial and Fraternal," "Working the Fields." Order the Chancellor and Imperial Secretaries to examine them according to the laws and ordinances.' In the sixth month, an edict declared: 'The carriages, riders, and horses are not complete. Order the realm to provide one horse and one chariot team.' In autumn, seventh month, an edict declared: 'If officials receive their subordinates but do not restrain them with law, then they become negligent and corrupt officials accomplish their private interests.' They receive punishment for perverting the law, or escape through affairs, or flee through wealth.' Now I continue to receive the imperial seal and ascend the throne. I follow the former kings' regulations, examine ancient and modern practices, change the laws, ease punishments, eliminate burdensome taxes, lighten corvee labor, eliminate hateful and evil things, and promote the filial and worthy.' I wish to make the people peaceful, officials not corrupt, superiors and inferiors harmonious, ghosts and spirits joyful, and prevent disasters and calamities from arising.' However, the people are not yet transformed, officials are not yet enlightened, prisons are not yet empty, lawsuits are not yet few, corvee is not yet light, taxes are not yet few, officials are not yet sufficient, people are not yet rich.' This is because my virtue is not yet bright, my teaching has not yet reached them, my governance is not yet perfected.' I am frightened and fearful, not knowing where to begin.' I have heard that in ancient times, the people were few and affairs were simple. Superiors were easy to serve, subordinates were easy to govern. Materials were sufficient for use, people were sufficient for labor.' Therefore the people were happy in their places, joyful in their occupations. The old and young had their proper places, men and women had their proper ways.' Evil and wickedness did not arise, litigation did not occur. The strong did not oppress the weak, the many did not bully the few. The orphaned and widowed were cared for, the poor and destitute were supported.' This was the beauty of the utmost governance.'

sentences.zh: 春正月，詔曰：「間者歲比不登，民多乏食，夭絕天年，朕甚痛之。

translations.literal: Spring, first month: He issued an edict saying: 'In recent years the harvests have repeatedly failed, the people mostly lack food, dying prematurely and cutting short their natural lifespans—I am greatly pained by this.'
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring, he issued an edict: 'In recent years, harvests have failed repeatedly, most people lack sufficient food, dying prematurely and cutting short their natural lifespans—I am deeply pained by this.'

sentences.zh: 郡國或磽骥，無所農桑诒畜；

translations.literal: Some commanderies and kingdoms have barren or hilly terrain, with no place for farming, mulberry cultivation, or livestock rearing;
translations.idiomatic: Some commanderies and kingdoms have barren or hilly land, unsuitable for farming, mulberry cultivation, or raising livestock;

sentences.zh: 或地饒廣，薦草莽，水泉利，而不得徙。

translations.literal: others have fertile and broad lands, lush grass, and beneficial water sources, yet cannot relocate there.
translations.idiomatic: others have fertile and expansive lands with lush grasslands and beneficial water sources, yet cannot relocate there.

sentences.zh: 其議民欲徙寬大地者，聽之。」

translations.literal: Therefore, deliberate on allowing people who wish to relocate to spacious fertile lands.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, deliberate on permitting people who wish to relocate to spacious and fertile lands.'

translations.literal: Now the people are numerous and affairs are complicated. Superiors are difficult to serve, subordinates are difficult to govern. Materials are insufficient for use, people are insufficient for labor.' Therefore the people are anxious in their places, resentful in their occupations. The old and young lose their proper places, men and women lose their proper ways.' Evil and wickedness arise together, litigation occurs frequently. The strong oppress the weak, the many bully the few. The orphaned and widowed are not cared for, the poor and destitute are not supported.' This is the calamity of the utmost disorder.'

sentences.zh: 夏四月，赦天下。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month: He granted amnesty to the world.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, he granted general amnesty throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 賜民爵一級。

translations.literal: He granted the people advancement in noble rank by one level.
translations.idiomatic: He granted all the people advancement in noble rank by one level.

translations.literal: I am not talented, my virtue is shallow and thin. I cannot make the people return to the ancient ways.' I will examine the current situation, follow what is suitable, change what is harmful, promote what is beneficial, abolish what is wasteful.'

sentences.zh: 遣御史大夫青翟至代下與匈奴和親。

translations.literal: He dispatched Grandee Secretary Qing Di to Dai to make peace and become relatives by marriage with the Xiongnu.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Grandee Secretary Qing Di to Dai to establish peaceful marriage relations with the Xiongnu.

translations.literal: I will make officials enlightened and not confused, the people transformed and not disordered, superiors and inferiors united in heart, inside and outside harmonized.'

sentences.zh: 五月，令田半租。

translations.literal: Fifth month: He commanded that fields pay half rent.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, he ordered that land taxes be reduced to half.

translations.literal: Then the ancestral temples will be secure, the altars of soil and grain peaceful, ghosts and spirits joyful, disasters and calamities will not arise.'

sentences.zh: 秋七月，詔曰：「吏受所監臨，以飲食免，重；

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month: He issued an edict saying: 'When officials accept what they supervise, being dismissed for accepting food and drink is severe;'
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, he issued an edict: 'When officials accept what they supervise, being dismissed merely for accepting food and drink is too severe;'

sentences.zh: 受財物，賤買貴賣，論輕。

translations.literal: accepting wealth and goods, buying cheap and selling dear, the punishment is light.'
translations.idiomatic: accepting wealth and goods, buying cheap and selling dear, the punishment is too light.'

sentences.zh: 廷尉與丞相更議著令。」

translations.literal: Let the Chamberlain for Law and the chancellor jointly deliberate and establish this as law.'
translations.idiomatic: Let the Chamberlain for Law and the chancellor jointly deliberate and establish this as law.'

sentences.zh: 廷尉 信謹與丞相議曰：「吏及諸有秩受其官屬所監、所治、所行、所將，其與飲食計償費，勿論。

translations.literal: Chamberlain for Law Xin Jin and the chancellor proposed: 'Officials and all ranked personnel who accept from their subordinates what they supervise, govern, execute, or command—if it is food and drink calculated to compensate for expenses, do not prosecute.'
translations.idiomatic: Chamberlain for Law Xin Jin and the chancellor proposed: 'Officials and all ranked personnel who accept from their subordinates what they supervise, govern, execute, or command—if it is food and drink calculated to compensate for expenses, do not prosecute.'

sentences.zh: 它物，若買故賤，賣故貴，皆坐臧為盜，沒入臧縣官。

translations.literal: Other goods, if bought cheap on purpose or sold expensive on purpose, all shall be convicted of corruption as theft, with the corrupt goods confiscated by the county authorities.'
translations.idiomatic: For other goods, if bought deliberately cheap or sold deliberately expensive, all shall be convicted of corruption as theft, with the corrupt goods confiscated by the county authorities.'

sentences.zh: 吏遷徙免罷，受 其故官屬所將監治送財物，奪爵為士伍，免之。

translations.literal: When officials are transferred, relocated, dismissed, or removed, if they accept wealth and goods sent by their former subordinates whom they commanded, supervised, or governed, strip their noble rank to commoner status and dismiss them.'
translations.idiomatic: When officials are transferred, relocated, dismissed, or removed, if they accept wealth and goods sent by their former subordinates whom they commanded, supervised, or governed, strip their noble rank to commoner status and dismiss them.'

sentences.zh: 無爵，罰金二斤，令沒入所受。

translations.literal: If they have no noble rank, fine them two jin of gold, and order confiscation of what they received.'
translations.idiomatic: If they have no noble rank, fine them two jin of gold, and order confiscation of what they received.'

sentences.zh: 有能捕告，畀其所受臧。」

translations.literal: Those who can capture and report such cases shall be given the confiscated corrupt goods.'
translations.idiomatic: Those who can capture and report such cases shall be rewarded with the confiscated corrupt goods.'

translations.literal: This is the constant way of the former kings, the great plan of governing the realm.' I will begin with the fundamental, make agriculture the priority, eliminate the secondary, stop the wasteful, prohibit the extravagant, prevent luxury.' Make the people diligent in their fundamentals, few in their desires, sufficient in food and clothing, joyful in their occupations.' Make the old and young have their proper support, men and women have their proper occupations.' Then the people will be transformed by the prevailing customs, morals will be pure, prisons will be empty, the world will be peaceful.' This is the way of the former kings, the accomplishment of great governance.' I am not enlightened. I cannot reach this alone.' I will rely on the three dukes, nine ministers, regional kings, marquises, officials of 2000 shi, scholars, and common people.'

sentences.zh: 二年冬十二月，有星孛于西南。

translations.literal: In the second year, winter, twelfth month, there was a sweeping star in the southwest.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month of winter in the second year, a comet appeared in the southwest.

translations.literal: Each according to their office, diligently perform their duties, examine the current situation, offer what is beneficial, stop what is harmful.'

sentences.zh: 令天下男子年二十始傅。

translations.literal: He commanded that men throughout the world begin military service at age twenty.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered that all men throughout the empire begin military service at age twenty.

translations.literal: Then my virtue will be bright, teaching will reach far, governance will be perfected.'

sentences.zh: 春三月，立皇子德為河間王，閼為臨江王，餘為淮陽王，非為汝南王，彭祖為廣川王，發為長沙王。

translations.literal: Spring, third month: He enfeoffed imperial son De as King of Hejian, Yan as King of Linjiang, Yu as King of Huaiyang, Fei as King of Runan, Pengzu as King of Guangchuan, and Fa as King of Changsha.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month of spring, he enfeoffed his imperial sons De as King of Hejian, Yan as King of Linjiang, Yu as King of Huaiyang, Fei as King of Runan, Pengzu as King of Guangchuan, and Fa as King of Changsha.

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, day Renwu: Grand Empress Dowager passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Renwu in the fourth month of summer, the Grand Empress Dowager passed away.

sentences.zh: 六月，丞相嘉薨。

translations.literal: Sixth month: Chancellor Jia died.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, Chancellor Jia passed away.

translations.literal: In the second year, spring, first month, an edict declared: 'Agriculture is the foundation of the realm, the root of the people, the beginning of officials.'

sentences.zh: 封故相國蕭何孫係為列侯。

translations.literal: He enfeoffed Xi, grandson of the former Chancellor Xiao He, as a marquise.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Xi, grandson of the former Chancellor Xiao He, as a marquise.

translations.literal: If the people are diligent in farming and sericulture, then superiors have enough to eat, inferiors have enough to wear, the national treasury is sufficient, the people are rich.'

sentences.zh: 秋，與匈奴和親。

translations.literal: Autumn: He established peaceful marriage relations with the Xiongnu.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, he established peaceful marriage relations with the Xiongnu.

translations.literal: If they leave the fundamentals and pursue the secondary, then superiors lack food, inferiors lack clothing, the national treasury is depleted, the people are poor.'

sentences.zh: 三年冬十二月，詔曰：「襄平侯嘉子恢說不孝，謀反，欲以殺嘉，大逆無道。

translations.literal: In the third year, winter, twelfth month, he issued an edict saying: 'Xi Ping Marquis Jia's son Hui Shuo was unfilial, plotted rebellion, desiring to kill Jia—greatly rebellious and without moral principle.'
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month of winter in the third year, he issued an edict: 'Xi Ping Marquis Jia's son Hui Shuo was unfilial and plotted rebellion, desiring to kill his father Jia—this constitutes great rebellion and moral depravity.'

sentences.zh: 其赦嘉為襄平侯，及妻子當坐者復故爵。

translations.literal: Therefore, pardon Jia as Xi Ping Marquis, and restore the original ranks to his wives and children who should have been implicated.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, pardon Jia and restore him as Xi Ping Marquis, and restore the original ranks to his wives and children who would have been implicated.'

sentences.zh: 論恢說及妻子如法。」

translations.literal: Judge Hui Shuo and his wives and children according to law.'
translations.idiomatic: Judge Hui Shuo and his wives and children according to the law.'

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings valued the farmer, honored the fundamental, despised the merchant, humiliated the secondary.' Now I hear that in the commanderies and kingdoms, the powerful and noble, officials and people, some leave farming and engage in profit, pursue the secondary and despise the fundamental.' This is the way to deplete the national treasury and impoverish the people.'

sentences.zh: 春正月，淮陽王宮正殿災。

translations.literal: Spring, first month: The main hall of the Huaiyang King's palace suffered a disaster.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring, the main hall of the Huaiyang King's palace suffered a fire.

translations.literal: King of Wu Pi, King of Jiaoxi Ang, King of Chu Wu, King of Zhao Sui, King of Jinan Bi Guang, King of Zichuan Xian, and King of Jiaodong Xiong Qu all raised troops in rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Kings Pi of Wu, Ang of Jiaoxi, Wu of Chu, Sui of Zhao, Bi Guang of Jinan, Xian of Zichuan, and Xiong Qu of Jiaodong all raised troops in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 大赦天下。

translations.literal: He granted a great amnesty to the world.
translations.idiomatic: He granted a general amnesty throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 遣太尉亞夫、大將軍竇嬰將兵擊之。

translations.literal: He dispatched Grand Commandant Zhou Yafu and General Dou Ying to lead troops and attack them.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Grand Commandant Zhou Yafu and General Dou Ying to lead troops against the rebels.

sentences.zh: 斬御史大夫晁錯以謝七國。

translations.idiomatic: He executed Grandee Secretary Chao Cuo to appease the seven rebellious kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 二月壬子晦，日有食之。

translations.literal: In autumn, seventh month, a comet appeared in the southwest.

sentences.zh: 諸將破七國，斬首十餘萬級。
追斬吳王濞於丹徒。
膠西王卬、楚王戊、趙王遂、濟南王辟光、菑川王賢、 膠東王雄渠皆自殺。
夏六月，詔曰：「乃者吳王濞等為逆，起兵相脅，詿誤吏民，吏民不得已。
今濞等已滅，吏民當坐濞等及逋逃亡軍者，皆赦之。
楚元王子蓺等與 濞等為逆，朕不忍加法，除其籍，毋令汙宗室。」
立平陸侯劉禮為楚王，續元王後。
立皇子端為膠西王，勝為中山王。
